data.author: David Svantesson

changelog.release_notes: First release.

data.description:
Public Transport app for West Sweden transport system (Västtrafik), showing the next departures (bus, tram, train and boats) in real time from the selected stop. The app uses the phones gps location to list the ten closest stops to you. It is also possible to set up to ten favorites (in phone settings). 

For the favorites you can optionally set up to three directions for each stop, then the app will filter the departures to only show those passing the stop you entered as direction.

latest_release.release_notes: First release.

data.description:
- This app once launched will exit immediately after config so you can continue to use other apps and faces. But it will buzz your Pebble (by default) every hour. Use it to remind yourself, for example, to stand up and take a quick walk or simple add hourly buzz if your current watchface doesn't support it.
- It doesn't take Activity tracker place so use MisFit or other background apps to your heart desire.
- It doesn't have any user interface (besides initial message) so it doesn't interrupt your current activity. It just buzzes.
- Configurable options include:
   * Buzz intensity (Short, Long, Double) - also themes from:
         - Super Mario
         - TMNT
         - Voltron
         - Final Fantasy
         - Star Wars
         - Power Rangers
         - James Bond
         - Mortal Combat
         - (Vibe themes by Gearside: https://gearside.com/custom-vibration-patterns-mobile-devices)
   * Buzz interval (from 1 to 120 minutes)
   * When to start interval (immediately, on exact hour change, half-hour change, 15-min change)
- You can suspend it by setting Buzz intensity to "Disabled"
- For $0.99 you can unlock "Quiet Time" and have peaceful night (more premium features to come).

latest_release.release_notes: - switched Quiet Time feature to native Pebble quiet time

data.title: Nag for Pebble

changelog.release_notes: Improve Pebble Time Round support.

Support for american timezones! Upcoming shows now should display the correct time.
Fix subscriptions not being updated in case of network errors.

Improvements:
- Subscribe to timeline topics whenever is necessary
Fix a bug in "Report a problem"

Horray! Many bugfixes and new UI!
- New UI
- Add Popular Shows menu. Now you can add shows directly from your Pebble
- Better configuration screen
- Fix Upcoming menu displaying wrong date and time for some shows
- Many other bug fixes
- Introduced the possibility to report a problem.

I want to thank Matt for the help he gave while beta testing!
Fixed a bug preventing the Upcoming Shows menu to not display correctly on some devices.
Bug fixes
Timeline support! View your schedule in the Timeline and check-in the episode you are watching!

Now the app caches the result, so that you can use it while you are offline.
Also, great improvement in startup times!
Fix non-working config screen.

- Advanced menu
- New production server
First release

changelog.release_notes: - Fixed an error in AppGlances

- Added error dialog if voice dictation fails
- Modified smart alarm algorithm
- Fixed rendering bug on round pebbles
- Fixed possible bug for migration to the new alarm format.

- New Features for Pebble Time users:
-- longer descriptions (20 chars)
-- per-alarm-smart-alarm
- Added Italian translation (thanks to francescom!)
- One can back out of Konami mode now!

- Found 2k of heap memory -> 24 alarms for OG Pebbles
- 16 Alarms on OG Pebbles

- Fixed memory issues
- Experimental smart alarm support

data.description:
This app is open source! If you like my apps heart them in the appstore and consider a donation (link is at the source link of this app).

With Alarms++ you can flexibly schedule up to 32 alarms on specific weekdays and add descriptions to each of them. 
- NEW: Smart alarm feature! You can set a certain amount of minutes you want to sleep into your alarm. Alarms++ only wakes you if you move or transition from deep to normal sleep (or latest after that set amount of minutes) This can be set per alarm. The small number next to the weekdays shows the current smart alarm setting. 
- NEW: Konami-mode! Select "Dismiss alarm: hard" in the advanced settings. Now you have to press a sequence of keys during wakeup to actually dismiss the alarm (the sequence changes randomly). This should avoid dismissing the alarm accidentially.
- NEW: Use your voice to dictate the alarm description! No more tertiary text input! 
- NEW: Your next alarm is pushed as a pin to Timeline!
- You could set alarms for your work days and another one for the weekend. 
- You can add descriptions to the alarms which will be shown when the alarm goes off. 
- Long-Press middle button to bring up a menu where you can disable and delete alarms
- Alarms without weekdays are so-called "one time" alarms. They will ring on the next possible weekday and then deactivate themselves.

latest_release.release_notes: - Fixed an error in AppGlances

data.title: Alarms++

data.description: Occasionally working contests as a HAM operator? Keep track of your worked count without the paper and pencil on your desk. Flick your wrist (or push a button) after each QSO and the counter is increased (buzz confirmed). No more forgotten or double numbers given out. It remembers your last session so you can get out for lunch with a normal watchface. Freebie!

data.description: This open source remote allows you to run shell commands in your linux by pressing Pebble buttons. You can use it for presentation slide changer or for example to lock your screen with single click. The app communicates directly with linux, and requires no extra android/ios app. On the linux host you need to install open source python add-on to control the actions.

서울 및 수도권 지역의 실시간 도착 정보만 볼 수 있는 앱입니다. 
설치 후 설정에서 먼저 정보를 입력해야 사용 가능합니다.
정보를 새로고침을 하려면 Select 버튼을 눌러주세요.
도착 정보를 보는 도중에 Up / Down 버튼으로 저장한 리스트의 다음 역으로 넘어갈 수 있습니다.

안되는 점이나 개선 점 등 의견이 있으시면 이메일로 보내주시기 바랍니다.

data.author: Halldor Einar Gunnarsson

changelog.release_notes:
New in release 1.23

Changed the delete menu to only clear the allowance amount and history. The settings will remain intact (currency symbol, fractions etc.).

Fixed a bug where in newer releases of the Pebble OS the back button would not work from the settings menu.
Changed the compilation settings to run on Aplite, Basalt and Chalk.

New in version 1.21: Added a settings menu, you can now specify the following: *The number of decimals to input *If you want to use fractions *Whether you want the currency symbol on the left or right side *The currency to use, a list of 18 currencies You hold the up button to enter the settings. Another new feature is a reset to default values. This will clear all variables from memory to default. Press and hold the down button to enter this menu. Since this was a complete rewrite of the code you might experience some problems after updating. Please use the new reset feature to correct that or reinstall the app.

New in version 1.2:

Added a settings menu, you can now specify the following:

     *The number of decimals to input
     *If you want to use fractions
     *Whether you want the currency symbol on the left or right side
     *The currency to use, a list of 18 currencies

You hold the up button to enter the settings.

Another new feature is a reset to default values. This will clear all variables from memory to default. Press and hold the down button to enter this menu.

Since this was a complete rewrite of the code you might experience some problems after updating. Please use the new reset feature to correct that or reinstall the app.

New in release 1.1:

Now the history keeps 5 records instead of 4 before.

Now you see how long ago each transaction was made, first in minutes, then hours and lastly in days.

If you are upgrading from version 1.0 the old transactions will have a strange timecode because it was never registered before. This will resolve itself once you add new transactions. A fresh install will behave correctly from the start.

Small changes in appearance but mostly like it was before.

data.description:
This app keeps track of your allowance. The select button cycles through the numbers in the amount you wish to enter. When you cycle past the last number the amount you entered will be subtracted from your allowance. To add funds to your allowance simply hold down the select button at any time to add the amount you entered.

To enter the settings menu press and hold the up button. There you can change various settings, including the currency used.

To clear the allowance amount and history press and hold the down button. You will be asked to confirm your choice.

latest_release.release_notes:
New in release 1.23

Changed the delete menu to only clear the allowance amount and history. The settings will remain intact (currency symbol, fractions etc.).

Fixed a bug where in newer releases of the Pebble OS the back button would not work from the settings menu.

data.title: Allowance

data.description: Buzzer is a simple watchapp that vibrates the watch on a user-set interval. Simply start the app, set how many minutes you want between buzzes and go. data.author: Klaus Demerath

changelog.release_notes:
v1.9 Timeline support (thanks to jsexauer)
Fix:
- Displayissues regarding decimal numbers
Feature:
- Timeline support for tasks. Task without a time are set to noon in timeline
- Response card after task completion
- Refresh task list after marking a task complete
- Streak information added / subtitle to fully display task name was removed

v1.8 - Checklists available

Fix:
- fixed a bug where you could not check off a task if it had a checklist
- menu issues resolved
Feature:
- long select (press longer on the select button) a task to score it

v1.7 - Checklists available

- migrated from Habitica API v2 to API v3
- Checklists are accessible. If a task has a checklist you can access the checklist by selecting the task. At the checklist you can check of the different checklist items by selecting them.

- Fix: Mana is not shown before level 10
- Enhancement: Checklist status is shown in task list (e.g. 3/7)
- Enhancement: Chalk (Pebble Time Round) is supported from now on

v1.5
Fix:
- Dailies with daily frequency and future start date are not shown anymore
Feature:
- Mana available in user stats

v1.4
- the Dailies list shows ONLY due Dailies
- the current Health at the stats card has 0 decimal

v1.3
- added colors for basalt platform
- task list items show more of tasks name in subtitle now
- new start menu showing two sections: tasks and user. tasks section has habits, dailies and to-dos. user section has only stats. selecting one of them brings you to the appropriate task list or user stats information.
- a card with user stats has been added. showing HP/Exp/Gold/Lvl
- a screenshot of the up/down scoring card has been added to the app store

v1.2
- for habits with 'up' and 'down' direction/action you can choose direction

v1.1
- only tasks which are not completed are shown
- menu item showing
- more images and some code cleanup

v1.0
- settings page to enter user id and api token
- welcome screen
- task list
- select task marks it complete or scores up

data.description:
This watchapp lets you access your habitica (aka habitRPG) tasks and mark them completed.
Select a task in the tasks list and press 'select'. The selected tasks get IMMEDIATELY marked as completed or scored up. For habits with up AND down direction/action you can choose the direction in the upcoming card. If you have a task with a checklist you access the checklist via the task. To mark these tasks as completed you have to 'long select' - press select for a longer time - them.

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.9 Timeline support (thanks to jsexauer)
Fix:
- Displayissues regarding decimal numbers
Feature:
- Timeline support for tasks. Task without a time are set to noon in timeline
- Response card after task completion
- Refresh task list after marking a task complete
- Streak information added / subtitle to fully display task name was removed

data.title: Habitica Tasks

data.description: Measure & Calculate the Pulse heart rate and blood oxygen saturation using iPhone and Pebble SmartWatch. FEATURES: - Assess pulse and blood oxygen saturation - History of previous measurements - Tilt for Data Chart - Designed for iPhone/iPod Touch
data.title: Instant Pulse Oximeter

data.author: Wearlynx, Inc.
data.description:
Create your own instant social network on your Pebble with CircleLynx.

Invite friends, family or colleagues to a private “Circle” to share location, chat, and find each other in a crowd.  

•	See how near or far away everyone in your Circle is at a glance to your Pebble.  Keep your friends as close as your pulse.
•	Send messages to everyone in your Circle, including customizable one-touch quick messages from your Pebble.
•	Get notifications when anyone in your current circle is near.  
•	A new kind of location sharing: CircleLynx shows how far away you are, in what direction. Your exact map location is only sent when you choose to share it.
•	Hit "Regroup" to find each other  - CircleLynx turns your Pebble into a homing mechanism so you can find each other easily in a crowd. 
•	Invite friends with a one-touch, private link sent by the app via text message. Beautiful. Simple. Seamless.
•	Connect with exactly who you want, for as long as you want: 3 hrs at a festival with friends, 90 mins to get together for lunch with colleagues, or all day at a conference. Your Circle is your private channel to chat and find each other at any event.

Connect with the people you want, whenever you want, for as long as you choose - all through your Pebble!
data.title: CircleLynx

data.author: Andrzej Marczewski

data.author: Harvest

changelog.release_notes:
tore and share your VCARD, Business Card or Contact information in a QR Code on your Pebble smartwatch.

This app could let you enter your VCARD information and turn it into a QR code containing a VCARD with your contact information.

The app sync the QR code image to Pebble and store the QR in pebble. You could share your QR VCARD infromation with your Pebble Smartwatch anywhere, anytime!

To read the QR VCARD in pebble, you could download and use 'RedLaser', 'QuickScan', 'QR Code Reader' to read the QR VCARD(Business Card) information.

This app allow anyone with a QR reader to read and import your VCARD(contact information) into their address book quick and easily!

data.description: Share my personal info in a scanner. Turn my personal contact information into QR code and store in pebble smartwatch and share them in a QR scan.
data.title: QR - Share my VCARD, Business Card and contact information conveniently: scan, laser, address, book, reader, write, camera,video, quick, response, generate, create, builder

This is an app to quickly check the status of the public bicycles of Gothenburg.

data.description:
WatApp uses the University of Waterloo Open Data API to display information on your wrist.

It includes the following;
~ Weather - Displays the University weather forecast for the day.
~ Food Services Locations - Displays food services locations including a description, building location, notes, and hours of operation.
~ Food Services Menu - Displays the weekly menu (lunch and dinner) for food service outlets
~ Coop Infosessions - Displays employer infosessions for the current term
~ Holidays - Displays upcoming University holidays
~ Parking availability - Displays the number of available spots in parking lots

changelog.release_notes: Add support for Pebble Time Round
New configuration page. Should now work better with Android users.

* Update URLs from Settings -- no more deleting and re-adding
* Multiple actions in settings (you can update, delete, and add as many times as you like without the Settings closing.. Be sure to Save to Pebble though).
* Long vibrate = SUCCESS -- No longer shows confirmation page on success
* Double short vibrate = error. When an error occurs, the error details (if any were provided) are now shown.

For some reason, I can't get the Menu Icon to work properly. I am working on it though.

data.description:
Launch actions via URL. No companion app needed.

* Long vibrate = Success
* Double short vibrate = Error (Error message shown)

Add URLs in the app settings and trigger them from your Pebble. Simple as that. 

Add location variables to your URLs. See settings for more information. More variables to come.

0.02 Early Public Beta

data.description:
Introducing flicks - a watch app created to do whatever you want whenever you want - right on your wrist.

flicks is a fully configurable and scriptable app that lets you quick launch anything on your computer or any device capable of running nodejs.

What's the fastest way to get going? 
- Install the app. 
- Download and launch the server by running "node server.js". 
- Save the IP to the watchapp settings. (NO PORT, NO HTTP://)
- Connect the phone to the same network as the server.

Configuration and Scripting
The config.js file is the meat of the application. It includes examples that should function on most Windows computers. 

flicks will work on any OS - modify the configuration any way you want - it's fairly self-explanatory but a full documentation will come within a few updates.You can call entire scripts just like you would from the command line. Don't forget to restart server.js when you make changes to config.js!

Controls 
Here's the fun part. Upon boot, the Pebble will grab your configuration from the server and display the first one on the screen. To activate it - either flick your wrist or press select. You'll see a dot at the bottom right when you activate commands. When it goes away and the watch vibrates, execution was completed. You can cycle through your functions with the up/down buttons, and if you long-press select it will refresh the configuration from the server or reconnect.

Documentation available @ https://gitlab.com/n4ru/Flicks

Please report any bugs or feature requests!

latest_release.release_notes: Disable wrist action because it had issues (awkward). It will be back.

With Groove for Pebble you'll immediately know whether you have to react or can continue relaxing at the pool.

changelog.release_notes: Bugs fixed

data.description:
Rock-paper-scissors is a game when each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes with an outstretched hand. These shapes are "rock" (a simple fist), "paper" (a flat hand), and "scissors" (a fist with the index and middle fingers together forming a V). 

The game has only three possible outcomes other than a tie: a player who decides to play rock will beat another player who has chosen scissors ("rock crushes scissors") but will lose to one who has played paper ("paper covers rock"); a play of paper will lose to a play of scissors ("scissors cut paper"). If both players throw the same shape, the game is tied.
data.title: Rock Paper Scissors

data.author: Joshua Gilliland

changelog.release_notes:
Typing in Morse v. 1.5 Fix:

- Backspace now works smoothly (can now delete as many times as inputted by user) by holding the top button per character deletion. This update is possible with the help of two of my brothers in resolving this issue.

V. 1.4:

- Now supports a Morse Code reference!
  - If you don't know a letter, number, or a certain punctuation mark in morse code, simply flick your wrist (or tap your Pebble) when the input is empty and it will load a reference sheet! Scroll through the pages with those fancy up/down buttons, and when you are done, flick/tap again to return to your text!

Version 1.3:

- Added a letter preview, so you know what your input is before you enter it!
- New line: "+-+-"
- Type in the wrong thing? No problem! Flick your wrist to clear the input and sample letter!
- Fixed the automated uppercase/lowercase setting so it is smarter.

Please report any bugs/suggestions to joshuatgilliland@gmail.com

Thank you!
- Joshua T. Gilliland

What's new in version 1.2:

Whenever you erase the screen, the watch will vibrate. After erasing the screen or after typing a period (.), the case will switch to uppercase (unless altered manually) and then switch to lowercase, by default.

Fixes/Additions/Changes:

- Now supports uppercase/lowercase! Just press the bottom button when the input is empty to change cases.
- App now saves your precious data for your return!
- Backspace/screen erase/space keys now erase user letter input, to give you a new start on your inputs.


Please report any bugs to my email: joshuatgilliland@gmail.com

Thank you!

- Joshua Gilliland

Typing In Morse (Beta) is currently at version 1.0. This is a rough upload with the basic foundations of an app that will (hopefully) soon become a large-scale texting platform in an easy, convenient way.
This app is open to any suggestions, comments, complaints, ideas, etc.

data.description:
Typing In Morse (Beta) is a fun and quick way to write text with the Pebble via Morse Code. Future updates hopefully will feature different fonts/background color, texting through phone, and much more. Top: + (Dot) / Hold for Backspace (currently only deletes last letter typed) Middle: - (Dash) / Hold for Space Bottom: Enter / Hold to erase all text OR if no input is entered, it changes cases (uppercase/lowercase) 

 To open the reference sheet, flick your wrist when the input is empty! Scroll through the pages as you deign fit, and then flick again to return to the main text interface.

latest_release.release_notes:
Typing in Morse v. 1.5 Fix:

- Backspace now works smoothly (can now delete as many times as inputted by user) by holding the top button per character deletion. This update is possible with the help of two of my brothers in resolving this issue.

data.title: Typing In Morse

data.description:
Sitting still for long periods of time can be detrimental to your health. This app reminds you to stand up and move around to keep you happy and healthy.

It's ideal for those of us who work at a desk all day.

Features:
* Scheduler so you only get reminders when you want
* Motion detection to track when you've been stationary too long
* Snooze to pause reminders if not convenient (if you're at lunch or in a meeting, for example)
* NEW: Configurable vibration strength

Once the schedule and motion detection are set then there's no need to do anything more - the app works automatically.

IMPORTANT:
* If using the motion detect feature be sure to tell the app which wrist your watch is on.

latest_release.release_notes:
Added support for Pebble 2
Added 5 & 10 minute snooze options
Fixed Aplite crashes
Cleaned up resources

data.title: Get Up, Stand Up

data.author: SciPal

changelog.release_notes: For real workaholics added a possibility to set the work and rest time intervals larger that 1 hour.

A small update after a long time of being out of business. 
- In the previous version, when the background of the app was black, going back and forth to the menu with up and down buttons would hang the app. No, the library "EffectLayer" is updated and it works as it should. 
- initial update for "chalk". No specific adjustments, just a build that works for Pebble Round. If I have time, probably will make better adjustments for the round screen and might add some colors to the app.

Changelog:

- added possibility to stop the pomodoro timer after one work+rest period (see the Settings menu). Can be useful when one only wants to run two timers and stop: for example, while making a presentation at a meeting or giving a lecture, the first ("work" timer) can vibrate when half of the time has passed, and the "rest" timer will indicate when it is time to wrap up and finish the talk. 
- now the Long rest period is counted more properly. Before, the Long rest was activated after every, let's say 3, work periods, but the number of work periods that was used was in fact the "total number work periods for the whole day" (indicated in the left top corner). Now, those work periods (let's say 3 of them) are counted every time one starts the pomodoro timer with the SELECT button.

Changelog:

- added possibility to pause the current timer with a press of SELECT button
- now long press SELECT stops the current (running) timer
- if no timers are running, the long press SELECT does not reset the statistics and counts anymore. Now, one has to go to the Settings menu and select "Reset all" there
- while running the timer, one can shake the watch or press UP or DOWN button to see the small digital timer (showing either the time that elapsed or time that left for the current period (work or rest)
- Now, in the Settings menu one can specify what the small digital timer shows: either the time that elapsed or time that left for the current period (work or rest)

Changelog:
- the counts (statistics of work-periods) is set to zero every day automatically
- with DOWN button LONG press one can now see some statistics over last 15 days
- minor interface adjustments

Changelog:

- added possibility to invert screen on Pebble (Steel) Time (white on black / black on white)
- fixed drawing inconsistency when using inverted screen

Changelog:
- added other levels for inactivity periods, now it can be set to 5, 10, 15 and 20 sec
- added SHAKE functionality, the clock will be hidden for a short time (corresponding to the inactivity period) and the current timer status will be shown for the rest or work period. 
- increased the font size of the status bar which shows the date and battery level

Changelog:
- improved behavior of long-press SELECT button

Changelog:
- fixed small bug with the long-rest periods
- added 6 vibration patterns that can be assigned to the rest or work events
- added option to invert the colors (only for Pebble and Pebble Steel)
- added battery level and date indicators in the statusbar
- some other minor GUI tweaks, not is it possible to specify if the app quits after a period of inactivity (10 or 20sec) or stays on the screen but switches to the clock-mode

Improvements:
- added settings dialog (UP button long press)
- added a possibility to specify long breaks/rest periods
- added a possibility to either close app every 10 sec after firing the event, or keep the app on the screen and show standard clock

Yet another Pomodoro like timer. This time it works in the background most of the time and does not drain the battery. It is possible to start the timer and quit the app using the BACK button. The app will wake up automatically when the "work" or "rest" events are finished, vibrate (depending on the event), will start the next event ("rest" or "work" respectively) and then will close itself in 20 sec from that moment, until the next wakeup. Navigation: - button UP: set the time for "work" (in minutes), only works when no timer is running - button DOWN: set the time for "rest" (in minutes), only works when no timer is running - button SELECT: start/stop the timer - button SELECT (long press): reset the timer and all statistics (counts of "work" and "rest" events which are visible in the left upper and lower corners

Changelog:
- Changed the name of the app in the menu
- Fixed the counter appearance for counts larger than 10 events

Yet another Pomodoro like timer. This time it works in the background most of the time and does not drain the battery. It is possible to start the timer and quit the app using the BACK button. The app will wake up automatically when the "work" or "rest" events are finished, vibrate (depending on the event), will start the next event ("rest" or "work" respectively) and then will close itself in 20 sec from that moment, until the next wakeup. 

Navigation:
- button UP: set the time for "work" (in minutes), only works when no timer is running
- button DOWN: set the time for "rest" (in minutes), only works when no timer is running
- button SELECT: start/stop the timer
- button SELECT (long press): reset the timer and all statistics (counts of "work" and "rest" events which are visible in the left upper and lower corners

data.description:
Yet another Pomodoro like timer. This time it can work either in the background (and will not drain the battery at all) or as a kind of watchface (draining the battery once a minute, like most of the watchfaces). It is possible to start the timer and quit the app using the BACK button. The app will wake up automatically when the "work" or "rest" events are finished, vibrate (depending on the event), will start the next event ("rest" or "work" respectively) and then will close itself in 5 - 20 sec (user settings) from that moment, until the next wakeup, or will switch to a watch-mode.

Navigation:
- button UP: (when no timer is active) sets the time for "work" (in minutes), (when timer is active) shows the elapsed time or time left
- button UP (long press): settings menu
- button DOWN: (when no timer is active) sets the time for "rest" (in minutes), (when timer is active) shows the elapsed time or time left
-button DOWN (long press): history over last 15 days
- button SELECT: start/pause the timer
- button SELECT (long press): stop the timer.
- SHAKE - hide the scipomodoro clock (not the watchface!) for a few seconds and show the current status of the (work or rest) timer
The statistics (counts of "work" and "rest" events which are visible in the left upper and lower corners) is reset every day automatically, or can also be done via the settings menu.

latest_release.release_notes: For real workaholics added a possibility to set the work and rest time intervals larger that 1 hour.

data.title: SciPomodoro

changelog.release_notes: QRBuddy now supports Android!
Changed app name

data.description:
Show your QR code on your wrist in a second.

1. Install iOS app 'QRBuddy for Pebble'
2. Install Pebble Watchapp 'QRBuddy for Pebble'
3. Save your QR code to your Photo Library, or you can take a picture of it through the iOS app
4. Launch the iOS app, and the Watchapp will be launched automatically
5. Choose your QR code from "Photo Library" by clicking the button at the lower left conner
6. Wait until the QR code is transferred
7. Now you can use your Watchapp only
8. To access the 'QRBuddy for Pebble' quickly, set 'Quick Launch' by long pressing either the up or the down button and choose WeChat Buddy

latest_release.release_notes: QRBuddy now supports Android!

data.title: QRBuddy for Pebble

data.description:
Counter app for pebble watch. From 1 to 10 player, you can choose the starting number.
The counter screen display a grid of player with their points. How to use :
- Choose the number of players and press select
- Choose the starting number and press select
- on the player grid :
   - press select to change selected player, the up / down to change their score
   - a long click on select button will open the menu to reset / restart the counter

data.description:
The Centiminutes app is a stopwatch that measures time in centiminutes, which are hundredths of a minute.

This watch is based on Big Stopwatch, so it has similar customizable settings for date format, screen background, vibration alerts, intervals, and more.

Use the bottom button to start/stop, the center button to briefly display the time, and the top button to reset. A long press of the center button activates the settings menu.

Yes, this is an unusual stopwatch.

latest_release.release_notes: 1.3  persistent storage fix

data.title: Centiminutes

data.description:
Stroke Keeper is the perfect watch app that you need to keep track of your golf score whenever your out on the course. I am proud to say that after a couple thousand of downloads we are still improving Stroke keeper's usability.
New Features in v3.0:
- an updated UI and layout
- Stroke Keeper is now in color for Pebble Time!
- confirmation window before starting a new round and erasing a past score
- bug fixes
*email me below for anymore suggestions.

latest_release.release_notes:
- added Pebble Time Round support
- performance improvements
- updated user interface

data.description:
Force turn on your backlight for 2 seconds.
Open backlight manually just like normal electric watch. It's especially useful when auto backlight off.
---
How to use?
1. Go to Settings > Quick Launch page
Set this app as down button (or up button)
long press
2. Long-press the button as you set in the watchface page, backlight will turn on for 2 second. 
---
Demo video:
https://youtu.be/VV7u0Loy_ko
---

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 1.3
- Support Pebble Time Round (Chalk)

data.title: TurnOnBacklight

data.author: Gianni Mario
data.description:
Pebble Time is awesome.
However, if you live in a country where you use Chinese characters, you probably know that Pebble Time can't display them properly!

This app installs Chinese fonts to your Pebble Time, so that they can be shown in notifications and apps!
data.title: Chinese & Japanese for Pebble Time
